meanings.sent1: The homologated document was stamped with the seal of approval.
meanings.sent2: The homologated report was accepted without any further questions.
meanings.sent3: The homologated certificate made it official that he was a certified expert.
meanings.sent4: Her homologated badge marked her as a trusted member of the team.
meanings.sent5: The homologated signature on the contract ensured its validity.

meanings.sent1: The committee homologated the new safety regulations.
meanings.sent2: The board homologated the decision to proceed with the project.
meanings.sent3: The judge homologated the marriage with a smile and a nod.
meanings.sent4: The manager homologated the employee's request for time off.
meanings.sent5: The council homologated the budget for the upcoming year.

meanings.definition: To make something official or valid
meanings.sent1: The notary homologated the will in front of witnesses.
meanings.sent2: The university homologated the student's transfer credits.
meanings.sent3: The referee homologated the goal after reviewing the video footage.
meanings.sent4: The government agency homologated the company's compliance with regulations.
meanings.sent5: The court homologated the settlement agreement between the parties.
